title: Four Wounded In Hartford Shooting
content:
HARTFORD — Four young people were shot at Brook and Winter streets on Friday night, and a fifth person may have been wounded, too, police said.
Early reports indicated that all injures were non-life-threatening, Deputy Police Chief Brian Foley. Limited details were available, he said.
The shooting was reported at 10:08 p.m. As police began investigating at Brook and Winter, they received a report of people shot on Magnolia Street.
Police determined that the 17-year-old twin brothers suffering from gunshot wounds on Magnolia had been wounded at the Brook Street scene.
